trans-unit.source: Set up iOS and Mac management | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Set up iOS and Mac management | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Enable mobile device management (MDM) for iOS devices including iPads and iPhones as well as Mac OS X devices with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Enable mobile device management (MDM) for iOS devices including iPads and iPhones as well as Mac OS X devices with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Set up iOS and Mac device management
trans-unit.target: Set up iOS and Mac device management

trans-unit.source: To set up your iOS or Mac device, you can find help [here](../enduser/using-your-ios-or-mac-os-x-device-with-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: To set up your iOS or Mac device, you can find help [here](../enduser/using-your-ios-or-mac-os-x-device-with-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Intune mobile device management of iPads, iPhones, and Mac OS X devices and give access to company email and apps.
trans-unit.target: Intune mobile device management of iPads, iPhones, and Mac OS X devices and give access to company email and apps.

trans-unit.source: An Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate is required for Intune to manage iOS and Mac devices.
trans-unit.target: An Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate is required for Intune to manage iOS and Mac devices.

trans-unit.source: Once the certificate is added to Intune, users can install the Company Portal app to enroll their devices or the administrator can set up [corporate-owned iOS device management](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: Once the certificate is added to Intune, users can install the Company Portal app to enroll their devices or the administrator can set up [corporate-owned iOS device management](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Set up Intune
trans-unit.target: Set up Intune

trans-unit.source: If you haven’t already, prepare for mobile device management by [setting the mobile device management authority](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md#set-mobile-device-management-authority) as **Microsoft Intune** and setting up MDM.
trans-unit.target: If you haven’t already, prepare for mobile device management by [setting the mobile device management authority](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md#set-mobile-device-management-authority) as **Microsoft Intune** and setting up MDM.

trans-unit.source: Get a certificate signing request
trans-unit.target: Get a certificate signing request

trans-unit.source: As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Administration** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Upload an APNs Certificate**, and click **Download the APNs certificate request**.
trans-unit.target: As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Administration** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Upload an APNs Certificate**, and click **Download the APNs certificate request**.

trans-unit.source: Save the certificate signing request (.csr) file locally.
trans-unit.target: Save the certificate signing request (.csr) file locally.

trans-unit.source: The .csr file is used to request a trust relationship certificate from the Apple Push Certificates Portal.
trans-unit.target: The .csr file is used to request a trust relationship certificate from the Apple Push Certificates Portal.

trans-unit.source: Upload APNs certificate dialog box
trans-unit.target: Upload APNs certificate dialog box

trans-unit.source: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate
trans-unit.target: Get an Apple Push Notification service certificate

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Apple Push Certificates Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=269844) and sign in with your company Apple ID to create the APNs certificate using the .csr file.
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Apple Push Certificates Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=269844) and sign in with your company Apple ID to create the APNs certificate using the .csr file.

trans-unit.source: After clicking **Upload** on Apple's Push Certificate Porta, you will receive a .json file which cannot be used for APNs.
trans-unit.target: After clicking **Upload** on Apple's Push Certificate Porta, you will receive a .json file which cannot be used for APNs.

trans-unit.source: Complete the download and return to the Apple Push Certificates Portal for **Certificates for Third-Party Servers** and click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Complete the download and return to the Apple Push Certificates Portal for **Certificates for Third-Party Servers** and click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: Download the APNs (.pem) certificate and save the file locally.
trans-unit.target: Download the APNs (.pem) certificate and save the file locally.

trans-unit.source: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your APNs certificate.
trans-unit.target: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your APNs certificate.

trans-unit.source: Add the APNs certificate to Intune
trans-unit.target: Add the APNs certificate to Intune

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Administration** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Upload an APNs Certificate**, and click **Upload the APNs certificate**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Administration** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Upload an APNs Certificate**, and click **Upload the APNs certificate**.

trans-unit.source: **Browse** to the certificate (.pem) file and click **Open** and then enter your **Apple ID**.
trans-unit.target: **Browse** to the certificate (.pem) file and click **Open** and then enter your **Apple ID**.

trans-unit.source: With the APNs certificate, Intune can enroll and manage iOS devices by pushing policy to enrolled mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: With the APNs certificate, Intune can enroll and manage iOS devices by pushing policy to enrolled mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Tell users how to get access to company resources with the company portal
trans-unit.target: Tell users how to get access to company resources with the company portal

trans-unit.source: Your users will need to know how to enroll their devices and what to expect once they're brought into management.
trans-unit.target: Your users will need to know how to enroll their devices and what to expect once they're brought into management.

trans-unit.source: What to tell your end users about using Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: What to tell your end users about using Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: End user guidance for iOS and Mac devices
trans-unit.target: End user guidance for iOS and Mac devices

trans-unit.source: If your company or organization purchases iOS devices for users, those devices can also be enrolled for management as [company-owned iOS devices](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: If your company or organization purchases iOS devices for users, those devices can also be enrolled for management as [company-owned iOS devices](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune
